spell.name: Castigate

time.condition: which you take in response to being mislead by a creature you are not in combat with

entries: You loudly berate an opponent who has either just lied to you or who has otherwise misled you or others.

The creature must be within range and able to see, hear and understand you. That creature must make a Charisma saving throw or immediately suffer from 1 level of {@condition exhaustion}, and gain disadvantage on any ability check to interact socially with anyone who heard the accusation for the next {@dice 1d4} days.
A creature has disadvantage on this save if as part of your beratement you provide hard evidence to support your claim.

spell.name: Barbed Spike
entries: You use a hammer to drive a large spike into the vent of a cannon or the hinge of a door, chest, or hatch.
A spiked cannon cannot fire until the spike can be pried out of the vent. A spiked hinge cannot be opened until the spike is removed.
To remove a spike, a creature must spend a minute using plier-like tools to attempt to pry it out. The creature must make a Strength (Carpenter's Tools) check against your gambit save DC.

A creature can remove the spike using other tools, but if they do so they do not add their proficiency bonus to their check. If no appropriate tools are available, a creature can still attempt a Strength check to remove the spike by hand, but does so with disadvantage.
If knock is cast on an object affected by barbed spike, the spike is immediately removed and the cannon or hinge functions normally.

spell.name: Beyond Reproach

components.m: a combination of clothing, makeup and forged documentation worth at least £ 7 which the gambit consumes

entries: With an elaborate combination of forged documents, a clever disguise, and a change in your pose and dialect, you create a cover identity. You can use this cover identity to move about unaccosted by those that might otherwise be suspicious of your actions, such as walking through an enemy camp or hostile town. Unless you give onlookers a reason to doubt your identity, your disguise holds up.

If your actions create doubt in a creature, it can use its action to inspect your appearance and must succeed on an Intelligence (Investigation) check against your gambit save DC. If it sees through your disguise your cover is blown and word quickly spreads, unless the creature(s) that saw through the disguise are dispatched. A blown cover identity can no longer be used and the cost to create it cannot be recouped.

Instead of creating a cover identity, you can attempt to create a cover identity that is an impersonation of another human. The target of your impersonation must make a Charisma saving throw, which is modified by how well you know the target and the sort of material objects you process that are related to them. This roll is made in secret by the DM. The creature is unaware that you attempted to create an impersonation regardless of the result.

rows: Secondhand (you have heard of the target)

entries: On a successful save, your impersonation does not pass muster and creatures familiar with the target will immediately see you as an imposter.
On a failed save, your impersonation is uncanny and your cover identity functions as normal, not rousing suspicion unless you give a creature a reason to doubt you.

spell.name: Blowback

time.condition: which you take in response to being in the effect radius of a grenade

entries: Reacting on instinct, you shoot at a grenade hurtling towards you, miraculously deflecting or disabling it.
Make a ranged attack roll with the loaded firearm and compare it to a result of the attacker's roll to throw the grenade.

If your result is higher than the attacker, you deflect the grenade back at them. The grenade detonates centered on the creature that threw it instead of its original target. If you roll lower than the attacker's your shot manages to disable the grenade, causing it to land harmlessly somewhere on the battlefield.
If you roll a misfire, you miss your opportunity to dodge, automatically failing your Dexterity saving throw to avoid the grenade's initial effect.
A grenade launched from a firearm or mortar cannot be deflected, only disabled by blowback.

spell.name: Create Draught

components.m: gathered herbs and plants, or venom

entries: You create a draught of poison or medicine using a variety of venom and plants.

When used to create medicine the draught functions as a Poultice of Healing. When used to create a poison it creates a single dose of any of the following poisons: Hellebore, Poison Sumac, Wasp Venom, or Widow's Bite.
Draughts created by this gambit function as described in chapter 4, except they cannot be sold and degrade after 8 hours if not utilized.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When cast as a 2nd level or higher gambit you create an additional draught for each level above 1st.

spell.name: Create Tincture

components.m: gathered herbs and plants, or venom

entries: You create a tincture of poison or medicine utilizing rare plants and venoms.

When used to create medicine the tincture functions as a Greater Poultice of Healing. When used to create a poison it creates a single dose of any of the following poisons: Bloodroot, Deadly Nightshade, Viper Venom, or Water Hemlock.
Tinctures created by this gambit function as described in chapter 4, except they cannot be sold and degrade after 8 hours if not utilized.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When cast as a 4th level or higher gambit you create an additional tincture for each level above 3rd.

spell.name: Dead Drop
entries: You find a nearby cache of ammunition and rations stored by members of your cause. The cache is full of enough rations to feed your companions for one day and some additional supplies, which cannot be sold. Roll a {@dice d12} and consult the table below to determine the supplies.

rows: 3 lb. of tallow and £ 1 worth of ammunition
Two vent picks and £ 1 worth of ammunition
Two portfire or one smokepot grenade(s)
A cryptic clue, as determined by the DM

entries: While at this cache you can leave a hidden message of 25 words or less visible to by a creature loyal to your cause, or a specific creature with whom you are familiar.
Any creature who finds the cache can search the location with an Intelligence (Investigation) check against your gambit save DC. On a success they locate your hidden message.

To locate the dead drop you must be near the outskirts of a town or settlement where there are partisans loyal to your cause. The number of caches within a mile of the town or settlement is determined by you DM, based on the local population and loyalty to your cause. On average caches are restocked once a week.

spell.name: Entrap
entries: Through tinkering, and a fair bit of cunning, you can set superior traps for your foes.
Choose either a hunting trap or a firearm you are carrying. You can create a spring-gun trap (described below) or secure a hunting trap to improve its effectiveness.

An improved hunting trap is nearly impossible to detect, requiring a successful Intelligence (Investigation) check against your gambit save DC to be discerned. When a creature fails its Dexterity saving throw against an improved hunting trap, instead of the normal effects, the creature takes {@damage 1d8} piercing damage and is {@condition restrained}. Each failed check to free a creature caught in an improved hunting trap deals piercing damage equal to your casting ability modifier to the trapped creature.

Environmental effects may destroy or reduce the potency of traps created by entrap left for longer than 24 hours. By spending 1 minute you can dismantle a trap you created and recover the item used to create it.
Mechanical trap
This trap triggers a firearm when a door or chest is opened, or when a creature walks through a trip wire.
When set with a trip wire, the wire is 3 inches off the ground and is stretched across a corridor no wider than 10 feet. The DC to spot the trip wire is 10 + the creator's proficiency bonus.
When set within a chest, or door, or other object with a hinge, the firearm is triggered when the object is opened. The DC to spot the mechanism is 12 + the creator's proficiency bonus.
A successful DC 13 Dexterity check using thieves' tools disables the spring-gun trap harmlessly. On a failed check, the trap triggers.

When the spring-gun trap is triggered, it makes a ranged attack with a +5 bonus against the creature that triggered it. On a hit, it deals the firearm's base damage (and does not add an ability modifier or any other additional damage). On a misfire, the firearm is destroyed and cannot be recovered.

spell.name: Defilade Position
entries: Surveying the land you locate an ample area to defend against artillery fire.
Choose a 15-foot radius of natural terrain. You reinforce the area's natural defense, preventing oncoming artillery shots from penetrating past the position.

This area is a sufficient barrier to artillery fire that it blocks shots when they hit the terrain. However, when the position is hit, all creatures inside must save against the effects of the artillery that targeted the terrain.
All creatures in the position have resistance to artillery damage as long as the defense holds.

When the duration expires, or the position is hit by a number of artillery shots equal to your gambit casting modifier, the fortification fails and no longer protects those inside or behind from the effects of artillery.

spell.name: Escalade
entries: Focusing on mountaineer training, you gain advantage on all Strength (Athletics) checks to climb and climbing does not cost extra movement.
If you lower a rope to your allies, you can grant advantage on Strength (Athletics) checks made to climb for the duration.

You can secure this rope with a block and tackle as an action, and use an action on subsequent turns to hoist a creature or object up to Large size a number of feet equal to 5 times your Strength modifier.

spell.name: Esprit de Corps
entries: You bolster yourself or an ally with a rousing speech about devotion to your cause. Choose a creature you can see within range and that can hear and understand as your champion. For the duration, the champion is immune to being {@condition frightened} and {@condition charmed} and gains 10 temporary hit points at the start of each of its turns, these temporary hit points are not cumulative.

When the champion hits an enemy creature with a weapon attack, that creature must make a Charisma saving throw against your gambit save DC. On a failed save, the creature suffers a -2 penalty on all attack rolls against targets other than the champion until the end of the champion's next turn.
When the gambit ends, the champion loses any remaining temporary hit points from this gambit.

spell.name: Fog of War
entries: You can only cast this gambit when you are behind natural terrain where that could reasonably hide you. Ducking behind cover, you vanish from the eyes of your enemies. You and everything you are wearing become {@condition invisible}. If you drop or remove an item, the item is no longer {@condition invisible}. If you move, make an attack or cast a gambit, the gambit ends.

spell.name: Non Sequitur
entries: When accosted, hailed, or challenged, target a number of creatures up to your casting modifier. These creatures must make an Intelligence saving throw or get drawn into argument, becoming distracted. If you or your companions are fighting any of the creatures, or if you do not speak their language, they have advantage on this save.

On a failed save, targets stop paying attention to you and cannot take a reaction in response to your movement until the beginning of your next turn. These creatures have disadvantage on Wisdom (Perception) checks made to perceive you for the next {@dice 1d4} rounds.

spell.name: Fougasse

m.text: shovels and £ 6 worth of ammunition which the gambit consumes

entries: You dig a large pit and fill it with gunpowder, shot, and debris, constructing a fougasse that can be used as a primitive mortar or a deadly mine. Once dug, you choose if you create a mortar or a trap (described below). Each additional creature with a shovel willing to help dig the pit reduces the casting time by 10 minutes, to a minimum of a 10 minute casting time.

If you create a mortar you designate a point within 120 feet as the target of the mortar. You do not need to have line of sight to this point but you cannot change the target once the pit is dug. You can trigger the blast as an action, raining a hail of debris and shot down in a 15-foot radius 60-foot-tall cylinder centered on your target point. Any creature in the blast must succeed on a DC 13 Dexterity saving throw, taking {@damage 3d8} fire damage and {@damage 3d8} bludgeoning damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.
If not detonated in 24 hours the fougasse becomes unusable and the components cannot be recovered. Foul weather may make the fougasse unusable sooner.
Mechanical trap

This trap uses a trip wire attached to a snaphaunce mechanism which ignites the buried powder. The tripwire is 3 inches off the ground and stretches between two trees or stakes. The DC to spot the tripwire is 10 + the creator's proficiency bonus. A successful DC 13 Dexterity check using thieves' tools disables the tripwire harmlessly. A character without thieves' tools can attempt this check with disadvantage using any edged weapon or tool. On a failed check, the trap triggers.

When the trap is triggered, the mine detonates exploding in a 15-foot radius centered on the middle of the tripwire. Any creature in the blast must succeed on a DC 13 Dexterity saving throw, taking 3d8 fire damage and 3d8 bludgeoning damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

spell.name: Foxfire
entries: You throw a handful of fungi and spores at a point within range, causing a flash of bioluminescence. The area glows with dim light in a 10-foot-radius for the duration.

Any creature in the area when the gambit is cast must make a Dexterity save or give away its location and have disadvantage on all stealth checks until they take an action to brush the fungi and spores off of themselves.

spell.name: Harsh Invective
entries: Your insults and curses wrack your opponent with pain. Choose a creature that you can see within range that can hear and understand you. That creature must make a Wisdom saving throw. On a failed save, the target takes {@damage 2d8} psychic damage, and has disadvantage on a saving throw of your choice for the duration.

Until the gambit ends, you may use a bonus action on each of your subsequent turns to inflict this damage again. If you do not share a language with the target, it takes half as much damage and has advantage on the save.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this gambit using a slot of 4th level or higher, the damage increases by {@dice 1d8} for each slot level above 3rd.

spell.name: Hold the Line
entries: You give a rousing speech, encouraging your companions and bolstering their resolve to keep fighting. The passion in your voice transcends language. All friendly creatures in a 30-foot radius that possess a language and can see and hear you becomes immune to being {@condition frightened} and gain a bonus to all saving throws equal to your casting modifier.

Until the gambit ends, you can use a bonus action on each of your turns to allow an affected creature to immediately move up to half their speed and take an action. This action can be used to attack (one weapon attack only), Dash, Disengage, Hide, or Use an Object or to reload or repair a firearm.

spell.name: Ignite Fervor
entries: Your determination and zeal inspires an ally to fight through their pain.

Choose a creature you can see within range and that can hear and understand you. That creature gains resistance to your choice of either melee attack damage, or ranged attack damage (damage from artillery is unaffected) for the duration.

spell.name: Intelligence Network
entries: You make contact with an agent loyal to your cause in a town or village. You can use this agent to gather information about the settlement or individuals within (except individuals under the effects of nondetection). Choose one of the following:
• Learn information and gossip pertaining to a specific local official.
• Learn tactical information about the placement of the town.
• Learn the breakdown of the town's loyalty to the King.
• Learn about local recent history.
• Learn the details and layout of a nearby garrison or army encampment.
Your spy will return in 8 hours with the information you choose to collect.

You can choose to gather more than one piece of information as part of casting this gambit, but doing so poses a risk to all involved. Choose an additional item to learn about from the list above. You can do this multiple times, but each time will increase the chance of a negative outcome. The DM rolls a {@dice d100} and consults the following table to determine your spy's success.

rows: The spy returns 8 hours later with the information.
Your spy encounters difficulty with their mission. They return in 8 hours, but have no information.
Your spy does not return, and is captured by hostile forces who are notified of your presence in this settlement.
Your spy is arrested for unrelated 'crimes.' They do not return, but remain loyal to your cause. Hostile forces are not notified of your presence in this settlement.
Your spy was detected but not captured. They return with the information in 8 hours, but they have been followed back to your location by hostile troops.
Your spy was turned by the enemy, they return in 8 hours with false information that may endanger the party. Hostile forces are notified of your presence in this settlement.
Your spy is killed during their mission. They do not return, but hostile forces are on higher alert for the remainder of your time in this settlement.

entries: For each additional piece of information that you send your spy to gather, the DM adds an additional 10 to the die result.
In a town or settlement friendly to your cause the DM subtracts 10 from this result. In a town or settlement that is hostile to you the DM adds 10 to the result.

spell.name: Improvised Artillery

components.m: a hollowed out tree trunk found or crafted which the gambit consumes

entries: By reinforcing the base of a tree trunk you create a makeshift cannon, loaded with round shot. An improvised cannon falls apart 8 hours after creation.
medium object - 30 lb.
{@b Armor Class:} 11
{@b Hit Points:} 20
{@b Maximum Crew:} 4
{@b Misfire:} 5
{@b Range:} 100/150 feet
{@b Damage Immunities:} poison, psychic
{@b Ammunition:} grape shot (£ 1), round shot (£ 1-10s)

This cannon's shots deal 4d8 artillery damage (see chapter 4 for the rules on how to fire and load artillery). If you serve as the gunner you can use your gambit attack bonus for the attacks with the makeshift cannon and gambit casting DC for saving throws.

On a misfire, instead of the normal effect, the cannon explodes. Every creature within 5 feet of the cannon must make a Dexterity saving throw based on your gambit save DC. A creature takes 4d8 artillery damage on a failed save or half as much on a success.
The makeshift cannon is created with a single shot, and additional shot can be purchased or crafted as normal.

spell.name: Leechcraft
entries: Using a treatment practiced since antiquity you carefully apply leeches on exposed skin of a willing creature. The removal of this excess blood invigorates the creature, restoring its humoral balance. This can to be draining to those weak of character.

After the leeches are applied, the creature must make a Constitution saving throw. You can choose whether or not to grant the creature advantage on this save; if you do so the creature is unaware of your choice.

On a success the creature increases its hit point maximum by {@dice 1d10} + your casting ability modifier, and it gains the same number of hit points. These hit points last for the duration of the gambit. The creature also make a new save against any and all diseases or poisons they are afflicted with, as if they it had completed a long rest.
On a failure, the creature is {@condition poisoned} and suffers 2 levels of {@condition exhaustion} for the duration.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this gambit using a gambit slot of 3rd level or higher, the creature increases it's hit point maximum by {@dice 3d10} on a success and suffers 3 levels of {@condition exhaustion} on a failure. When you use a gambit slot of 5th level or higher, the creature increases its hit point maximum by {@dice 5d10} on a success and suffers 4 levels of {@condition exhaustion} on a failure.

spell.name: Logjam
entries: Wiping the sweat from your brow, axe in hand, you ready yourself to demonstrate your mastery over timber.
Choose either an obstacle primarily constructed of wood or a large supply of fresh timber that you purchased or harvested valued at £ 4.
If you target an obstacle, such as a barricade, shipwreck, or log boom, you clear a 40-foot cube, hacking and dragging the debris out of the way and making the area safe to traverse.

If you target fresh timber, you roll out the logs to create a log trap (described below) or impediment. An impediment of logs can be no more than 10-feet wide and cannot span more than 40-feet. The area is difficult terrain, and cannot be traversed by vehicles or ships without a successful vehicle proficiency check against your gambit save DC.
Mechanical trap

This trap uses a tripwire to dislodge a wedge that is securing a stack of logs on an incline. The tripwire is 3 inches off the ground and stretches between two trees or stakes. The DC to spot the tripwire is 10 + the creator's proficiency bonus. A successful DC 14 Dexterity check using thieves' tools disables the trip wire harmlessly. A character without thieves' tools can attempt this check with disadvantage using any edged weapon or tool. On a failed check, the trap triggers.
Anyone who inspects the logs can easily determine that they were set up as a trap and can pull the wedge out as an action, causing the trap to trigger.

When the trap is triggered the logs roll downhill crushing creatures in their path, a 15-foot wide line. Any creature in the path must succeed on a DC 14 Dexterity saving throw or be knocked prone, taking 4d10 bludgeoning damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

spell.name: Portage
entries: You dip your hands into a cool body of water and consider the topography of the environment you find yourself in. You recall information gleaned from maps, word of mouth or natural philosophy about this body of water. You also determine if there is anywhere you can ford within 10 miles, what tide state the body is in, and if the water is safe to drink.

If there are trees and brush around the body of water, you can use them to create a makeshift raft or canoe. This watercraft uses the statistics for a rowboat, though it is half as durable. For each hour you spend casting this gambit, you can create additional watercraft up to your Wisdom modifier (minimum of one). These craft fall apart 8 hours after creation.
While piloting a craft you created, you are considered proficient in vehicles (water). If you already have proficiency, add double your proficiency bonus to checks to pilot waterborne vehicles.

spell.name: Rhetoric
entries: You focus on the cadence and diction of your words to best influence those around you. For the duration of this gambit, you can make a Charisma (Performance) check in place of any Charisma check you would make. Whenever you make a Charisma (Performance) check, treat a roll of 7 or lower on the {@dice d20} as an 8.

spell.name: Ricochet

components.m: a firearm loaded with cartridge or patch ammunition

entries: As part of the action used to cast this gambit, you must make an attack with a loaded firearm you have equipped, targeting one creature, object, or vehicle within your weapon's range. On a hit, the target suffers the attack's normal effects.

Hit or miss, the shot ricochets towards another target within 15 feet of the original target. You do not need a clear path to the second target, and it does not gain any bonuses from cover. It must succeed on a Dexterity saving throw or also suffer the attack's normal effects. If your attack missed, the second target has advantage on its saving throw.

spell.name: Ruse de Guerre

components.m: between 5-20 assisting creatures which must stay within 100 feet of you

entries: With signal fires, drums, shouts and creative use of terrain you make a small group of creatures seem like a large formidable force. While you maintain concentration on this gambit, you can coordinate with your allies to make it appear that a large force of troops is heading in the direction you chose. You can make this force appear to be deploying for battle, preparing for a siege, or mounting a retreat.

Enemy commanders from up to 5 miles away can attempt a Wisdom (Insight) check against your gambit save DC to see through your ruse. A commander who discerns the illusion for what it is, can pinpoint your location based on the movements of your allies.

This illusion's strength is directly proportional to the number of creatures assisting in the gambit. For every five creatures beyond the first five, increase the gambit save DC of this gambit by 2. If a creature is within 150 feet of your location or is observing through a spyglass, they have advantage on their Wisdom checks to see through this illusion or to track your group. A creature within 100 feet of you sees through the illusion.

spell.name: Sally Forth
entries: Shouting orders, you encourage a creature to push forward. Choose a willing creature that you can see within range and that can hear and understand you. Until the gambit ends, the creature's speed is doubled, it gains a +2 bonus to AC, and it has advantage on Dexterity saving throws.

The target can choose to voluntarily end the effect as their turn to gain an additional action. That action can be used only to Attack (one weapon attack only), Dash, Disengage, Hide, Use an Object, or to reload or repair a firearm.

spell.name: Stinkpot
entries: Using foul-smelling materials and a mix of black powder, you create a noxious explosive.
Any creature can throw the stinkpot grenade using their attack bonus. The stinkpot degrades after 8 hours if not utilized.
Martial Weapon - Misfire 2

When a stinkpot detonates, each creature in a 10-foot radius sphere of its detonation point must make a DC 14 Dexterity saving throw. A target takes 2d6 fire damage and 2d6 piercing damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

After the initial blast, a cloud of stinking air remains in a 15-foot radius from the detonation point. For 1 minute, each creature that is completely within this cloud at the start of its turn must make a DC 14 Constitution saving throw. On a failed save a creature is poisoned and moves at half speed until the beginning of its next turn. A moderate wind (at least 10 miles per hour) disperses the cloud after 4 rounds. A strong wind (at least 20 miles per hour) disperses it after 1 round.

spell.name: Stock and Barrel
entries: Touch a non-masterwork firearm. It becomes masterwork, gaining a +1 to attack rolls until the gambit ends.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you use a gambit slot of 3rd or higher, the bonus increases to +2. When you use a gambit slot of 5th level or higher, the bonus increases to +3.

spell.name: To The Gallows
entries: Through condemnations and threats, you instill a sense of the dread into your foes. Choose a language you know. Any creatures you choose that understand the chosen language within a 20-foot-radius centered on you must make a Wisdom saving throw. A creature takes {@damage 4d10} psychic damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.
On a failed save, the affected creatures are also {@condition restrained} until the end of their next turn, as they struggle with their own mortality and lose focus of the world around them.
If a creature's saving throw is successful, the creature is immune to the gallows for the next 24 hours.

spell.name: War Paint
entries: You apply paints and pigments to the face of a creature, as part of a traditional ritual or to create an intimidating visage.
The creature gains advantage on their next attack roll and {@dice 1d6 + 2} temporary hit points.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this gambit using a gambit slot of 2nd level of higher, you can target an additional creature for each slot above 1st.
